[[Defence Materiel Organisation|Support Command (Australia)]]
Logistics Command (Army) |unit = |battles = |awards = [[Officer of the Order of Australia]] |laterwork = }} [[Lieutenant General (Australia)|Lieutenant General]] '''Desmond Maurice "Des" Mueller''' [[Order of Australia|AO]] (born 25 July 1943) is a retired senior officer of the [[Australian Army]]. He served as [[Vice Chief of the Defence Force (Australia)|Vice Chief of the Australian Defence Force]] from June 2000 until his retirement in July 2002. Mueller was born in [[Adelaide]] and enrolled in the [[Royal Military College, Duntroon]] in 1961, graduating in 1964. He served with the 28th Commonwealth Infantry Brigade in Malaysia from 1965 to 1967. Following a gunnery staff course at the School of [[Artillery]] in the [[United Kingdom]], he held various appointments as Instructor-in-Gunnery, Adjutant, Battery Commander and Commanding Officer of the School of Artillery. In 1989 Mueller was promoted to [[brigadier]] and became Director General of Army Development. In 1990 he became the Director General Force Development (Land), responsibility for the development of land forces capability. In 1994, he was promoted to [[Major General (Australia)|major general]] and appointed General Officer Commanding Logistic Command. Following the merger of logistics management for all three services ([[Royal Australian Navy|Navy]], [[Australian Army|Army]] and [[Royal Australian Air Force|Air Force]]), Mueller was appointed the first Commander Support Australia. In 2000, he was promoted to [[Lieutenant General (Australia)|lieutenant general]] and became the Vice Chief of the Defence Force. Mueller was awarded [[Member of the Order of Australia]] (AM) in 1993, and was elevated to [[Officer of the Order of Australia]] (AO) in 1998. Following retirement from the Army, Mueller continued a career in consulting, management and academia, serving as an adjunct professor at [[Monash University|Monash]] and [[Latrobe University|Latrobe]] universities. ==References== *[http://www.defence.gov.au/minister/Mooretpl.cfm?CurrentId=249#mueller Department of Defence Press Release, 2 May 2000] *[http://www.itsanhonour.gov.au/honours/honour_roll/search.cfm?aus_award_id=878843&search_type=simple&showInd=true AM entry and citation], 26 January 1993, It's a Honour *[http://www.itsanhonour.gov.au/honours/honour_roll/search.cfm?aus_award_id=879610&search_type=simple&showInd=true AO entry and citation], 8 June 1998, It's a Honour {{s-start}} {{s-mil}} {{succession box| title=[[Vice Chief of the Defence Force (Australia)|Vice Chief of the Defence Force]]| before=Air Marshal [[Douglas Riding]]| after=Vice Admiral [[Russ Shalders]]| years=2000 – 2002| }} {{s-end}} {{Vice Chief of the Defence Force (Australia)}} {{Persondata | NAME = Mueller, Desmond | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 25 July 1943 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Adelaide]], [[South Australia]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Mueller, Desmond}} [[Category:1943 births]] [[Category:Australian generals]] [[Category:Duntroon graduates]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Officers of the Order of Australia]] [[Category:People from Adelaide]]
